reviewText: Excellent price and movie was great. Enjoyed every second of it. Delivery date was adhered to and speedy as well. Worth the time to watch it.

The Assault(DVD
I think that for around half a century film actresses have had a raw deal with roles, especially in English-speaking countries, where they are better served in TV dramas anyway. US/UK movies overly depend on only a handful of names such as Meryl Streep, Susan Sarandon, Helen Mirren etc., that have screen presence and can secure quality work.  Therefore I find that the option I tend to go for is in (generally very low budget) kick-ass female-led actioners such as this one, on a reasonably priced DVD of a 1996 movie.  This hardly demands great acting (lots of the old "get down!" clichs) but at least it gives the ladies something to get their dainty teeth into.  The plot is rarely ever plausible  and the basement into which the gals retreat under siege is factory-size enormous, but it's a fun watch all the same.  I thought it hilarious when the end credits gave thanks to a certain owner that allowed the film company to blow up his house for the climax.  Paul Williams, Eastbourne, UK.
Amazon verified purchaser.

One of Director Jim Wynorski's best.

Good action and story,with Jim's usual players.
Stacie Randell and Matt McCoy are great.

Highley Reccomended.

Their plan to ending this whole problem is lour all of the guys inside the house leaving the gas on then they will sneak out from the basement once they are inside thats when one will light a match to set the house on fire.
